phrase: Right foot ulcer that's been there for a couple of weeks
It's been there gosh it's six or eight weeks and it's just not going away... maybe even gotten a little worse.
Diabetic... on some insulin... sugars been running... a little higher than normal
Last hemoglobin A1c was above nine
Initially... stepped on a nail or there was some other work... led to anything
No fever or chills... tension headaches pretty often
Occasionally... numbness and tingling in feet... colder weather
Former smoker... two packs a day for twenty plus years... stopped four years ago
No pain in calves when walking... no shortness of breath
No palpable dorsalis pedis or posterior tibial pulses
Two by three centimeter ulcerated lesion... lateral foot near the fifth metatarsal... no cellulitis... granulation tissue and slight purulent discharge
Nonhealing ulcer of your foot... need to do some studies... blood supply to heal this foot wound
Vascular surgeon's office... stent to one of your arteries... bypass surgery... improve blood supply
Continue with aspirin... help with blood supply
Arterial ultrasound of lower extremities... podiatry consult... improve wound care
Diabetes... unstable... need to get better controlled... impacts wound healing
